title: On startup any selected item is disregarded shortly after
author: KvnSC
body_snippet:
Hello everyone,

I've been experiencing an issue regarding the latest mRemote version(1.76.11), that I use in conjunction with my SQL server 2017(WS2016). The issue is whenever I open mRemote and immediately start typing or clicking a connection/folder, the item that I just selected is no longer selected about 3 seconds after opening mRemote. Afterwards the "Connections"(globe icon) is selected and highlighted in my directory, as if I never touched anything. I've tested this issue with an expa...

iterations.description: The issue involves the UI selection state being reset or lost during the application startup sequence, likely due to a race condition between UI rendering and background loading/refreshing of the connection tree.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Hi @KvnSC! Yes, this is a known issue with the current implementation and something we are looking to address. The next hotfix should resolve some of these issues (folders expanding on their own, for example).

comments.author: KvnSC
comments.snippet: Thank you very much for the quick answer. I'll stay tuned for updates in the future! :)

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The issue involves the UI selection state being reset or lost during the application startup sequence, likely due to a race condition between UI rendering and background loading/refreshing of the connection tree.
Approach: Investigate the startup lifecycle events (Load, Shown) in FrmMain and the data loading process in ConnectionTree. Identify where the selection is being cleared or overwritten (e.g., by a late 'Clear' call or a delayed data binding event). Implement a fix to preserve the user's selection or defer the selection restoration until the tree is fully initialized and stable.
